content.body: How would the : separator, without parens, work with typescript?
i guess `when ${x as y}: RHS as z` would be fine, since there's no `:` type declarations there
content.formatted_body: i guess when ${x as y}: RHS as z would be fine, since there's no : type declarations there

content.body: Does TS use colons for something near that syntax space?
Neither : or -> used in ts as I can recall.
Ah, `:` is used in the same way it is in Python, to annotate a variable.
content.formatted_body: Ah, : is used in the same way it is in Python, to annotate a variable.

content.body: I recall yulia wanted us to avoid `->` for TS-adjacent reasons, but I don't remember the details of it. Was it to reserve the space for JS to potentially grow annotations?
content.formatted_body: I recall yulia wanted us to avoid -> for TS-adjacent reasons, but I don't remember the details of it. Was it to reserve the space for JS to potentially grow annotations?

content.body: But yeah, `:` in pattern space would be just fine, it's wouldn't be capable of receiving an annotation.
content.formatted_body: But yeah, : in pattern space would be just fine, it's wouldn't be capable of receiving an annotation.

content.body: Tho hm, I suppose `when a: int: RHS` might be reasonable?
content.formatted_body: Tho hm, I suppose when a: int: RHS might be reasonable?
